programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Raw Travel
programme.desc: For some travelers, the rush of travel is enough but others need more. Raw Travel invites viewers to sample the growing eco & adventure travel movement with “Raw Adrenaline”.

programme.title: The Colours of China
programme.desc: Five colours are an integral part of contemporary China and the ancient philosophy of Wu Xing. Each episode takes us to regions where we meet our characters, learn how Wu Xing sits in their lives and explore the landscapes they live in.

programme.title: Gourmet Escapes
programme.desc: Chef Massimo Capra visits Playa Del Carmen to experiencing a resort with its own hydroponics greenhouses. Fresh daily vegetables and spices are delivered to the resort chefs along with the local fresh catch of the day. Massimo experiences resort gourmet cooking and how to make authentic Mexican food and sauces. His Chef have set up a large grill on the beach and have the catch of the day brought in to cook up an amazing meal, complete with cerveza...OLE!

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: Take A Seat: Egypt
programme.desc: Ahmed swaps out with John, a wiry Coptic Christian from Alexandria. He helps Dominic up the steep hills of Egypt’s only mountain range to the ancient and significant St Catherine's Monastery and Mt Sinai. Aided by a camel, they climb the mountain and reflect on the last 10 days of the journey to come.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam, Julian, and Jenn experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country. They use things such as trucks, cars and motorcycles, and they also experiment with ATVs, boats, jet skis, and air travel. Each episode features their competition with each other, including wagers, witty banter and adrenaline to keep the viewers entertained. They are continuously learning as they try out these new modes to see which one they consider the best. This is "It's How You Get There".

programme.sub-title: American Travelers: Lake Tahoe Lake of the Sky
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit Lake Tahoe, California and check out the Sierra Boat Company.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: Follow David Hayman as he unearths the people and places that make Scotland unique.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Marrakech, Philadelphia, Barbados & Martinique
programme.desc: We will go to the bustling city of Marrakech, where we will explore the citadel and the exciting market of La Medina, before moving out of the city towards the Ksar of Ait Ben Haddou, the wonderful Atlas mountains, the dunes of Merzouga and there we'll try the Couscous a rich dish of Moroccan food. Then we will go to Philadelphia, in the USA, where we will tour Independence Hall, the impressive City Hall building and a creepy historic prison. And before we go to our next destination, we will have an aperitif, the delicious hoagies sandwiches, also known as submarine sandwich. Our last destination of the day will be the Caribbean islands of Barbados, where we will make a catamaran cruise, visit the capital Bridgetown and finally move to Martinique, home to some incredible beaches and French cultural influences.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Liverpool, Poland & Oregon
programme.desc: We'll go to the United Kingdom, to the cradle and home of one of the most famous bands in the world, The Beatles. We will be in the fantastic city of Liverpool; which also has a legendary football club. There we will visit the Liverpool Lime Street train station which is the longest and oldest station in the city and the oldest terminal station that still remains in operation around the world. We will make a short flight, to know some of the most impressive castles of "Europe" surrounded by the Tatra Mountains in Poland and visit Wawel Hill, to hear a fantastic story of Polish Folklore that tells the story of a mythical and fierce dragon. We will continue to our next destination to visit some of the best national parks located in the northwest Pacific Ocean in the State of Oregon, in the United States of America. The Crater Lake National Park, a perfect place to camp with some of the best hiking trails in North America.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Venice, Scotland & Thailand
programme.desc: This time we are going to Venice, Italy, a beautiful city built between water canals, with picturesque houses, where we will travel through the Grand Canal in a gondola, explore the Venetian lagoon and the island of Burano, and take a look at the famous Piazza San Marco with its beautiful basilica. Then we will travel to Scotland, where we will reflect on the monster of Loch Ness, we will see some historical castles, such as the Castle of Uruqhart and the Castle of Stirling and finish off this visit to the land of knights and medieval stories we will go to a fantastic museum and walk to the top Arthurs Chair. Our last destination of the day will be Thailand. There, we will visit the floating market of Amphawa and participate in two festivals: one full of water and the other filled with lanterns, before relaxing on the beaches of Pattaya

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Seattle, Mongolia & Papua New Guinea
programme.desc: We start this journey in the Pacific Northwest, in a city with a tower that touches the space and where coffee is king, Seattle, Washington. A region that has a rich history of Native Americans, with the first inhabitants living here more than 4,000 years ago. With many jazz clubs where some of the most notable musicians in America developed their skills as Ray Charles and Quincy Jones. Then we will go to the fish market where we will see how the sellers throw huge pieces of fish from one side of the aisle to the other and you will know why they are called the "flying fish". Then we will travel over the Pacific Ocean to a land full of spirit and wonder, where we will visit some temples and even cross the desert expanse of Mongolia. We will visit the valley of the river Terelj, where we will find a small settlement, with small shops and restaurants and horseback riding or if you prefer you can get on a camel. Finally, we will go to one of the largest islands in the world, where a country rich in cultural diversity awaits us, Papua in New Guinea. An island, full of mystery and wonder and one of the least explored places to date. Where you will find tribes of people and complete species of animals and plants that are still waiting to be discovered.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Queensland, Beijing & The Bahamas
programme.desc: We will go to the famous golden coast of Queensland in Australia and visit Fraser Island, the largest sand island in the world. We will also climb the first roller coaster with motorcycles in Dreamworld Park, where you can also interact with koalas and kangaroos. Queensland is the capital of the theme parks in Australia. Then we will make a stop in one of the largest countries of our planet, Beijing, the capital of the Chinese Republic. We will visit its temples, squares, palaces and enjoy authentic Chinese food. We will visit Tiananmen Square, which besides being the most important in China, is the largest in the world, the scene of great historical events. We will enter the Forbidden City, an icon of Beijing and the residence of 24 Chinese emperors for more than 5 centuries.And the farewell will be done in The Bahamas, a true earthly paradise that includes around 700 islands of white sands and a water park where you will live an adventure like no other. We will visit Nassau to see its colonial-style architecture, streets full of color in which the customs and education of the British settlers are perceived. An example of this is that the cars circulate on the left.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Niagara, DC & Sichuan
programme.desc: We begin our journey in the monumental Niagara Falls, located between the United States and Canada. We will go on an exciting helicopter ride through the Falls and finally enjoy delicious buffalo wings. We will go to Washington DC, where we will know the monuments that decorate the National Mall, we will mix with the locals in Georgetown, we will walk the corridors of the White House and we will know firsthand what it means to defend the first amendment of the United States Constitution. with an exciting visit to the Newseum. We will finish in Asia, where we will visit the Chinese province of Sichuan. There, we will walk along the pedestrian street Jinli and try some spicy soup. Finally, we will enjoy a "beautiful experience" in the Research and Breeding Center of Giant Pandas.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Thailand, Florence & Ecuador
programme.desc: Today we go to Thailand, there we discovered a beautiful hidden beach: the beach of Railay, a small peninsula located in the south of Thailand, between the cities of Krabi and Ao Nang. And if you feel like climbing, well take you to some cliffs that are wonderful for climbers! Then we will travel to the wonderful city of Florence to see the beautiful Ponte Vecchio, which crosses the Arno river and the busy Piazza della Signoria, we will take a walk through the Museum and the tower of the Palazzo Vecchio. And to culminate our walk through this wonderful city of Italy we will teach you how to prepare some of the most delicious local dishes with the help of talented Italian chefs. Wait! Thats not all! After Florence we cross the planet to reach another continent and visit Ecuador. There, you will put one foot in each half of the world, we will explore a national park with an active volcano and you will see face-to-face iguanas in their own kingdom. You will know a country that has part of the Amazon rainforest, part of the Andes, has the Galapagos Islands and many small colonial cities. Did you know that if you stop at the top of Mount Chimborazo, the highest mountain in Ecuador, you will be closer to the sun than any other place on earth? This is because the equator, the imaginary line that divides the earth in its two hemispheres, crosses this country, thats why this nation got its name.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Tenerife, Canada & The Canton of Graubunden
programme.desc: This new tour around the world takes us to the Canary Islands, to concentrate on the colorful island of Tenerife, a place that will undoubtedly surprise you with its landscapes, its beaches and the majesty of El Teide Volcano. You can also taste a variety of dishes of Spanish cuisine and seafood. Then, we will take a very special tour of Canada. There you will meet three of its magical cities: Toronto, Vancouver and Montreal. A country with a great cultural mix product of its aboriginal traditions, its colonial heritage with Great Britain and France, and the constant welcome to people from different regions of the world who dare to travel to this country in search of new adventures.To close we will discover The Canton of Graubunden, one of the most attractive places in Europe and which every year becomes the ideal destination for thousands and thousands of tourists. We will make a tour visiting St. Moritz, cradle of the alpine winter holidays since 1864 and home to two editions of the Winter Olympics

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Barcelona, Japan & Alaska
programme.desc: Our tour begins on the shores of the Mediterranean in Barcelona, one of the European cities most visited by tourists from all over the world, where you can breathe art, avant-garde and rebelliousness typical of the diversity of culture. We will know La Rambla, it is a walk of twelve hundred meters that remains active until high night hours. Then we will go to Barceloneta, a coast lined with trees, urban artists, shops of all kinds and a large volume of people. Enjoy of tapas typical of Spain, a refreshing drink in this neighborhood of fishermen loaded stories. Afterwards, we will travel to Japan, one of the most attractive and vibrant countries of the Asian continent. If you like to delight yourself with the different flavors of the world, Japan is a destination that can not be missing from the list. Its different dishes of sushi, udon and tempura will make your stay an unforgettable taste. We invite you to know the Bamboo Forest of Arashiyama, where it is normal to see tourists with their heads tilted upwards to enjoy nature. To finish, we will discover the charms and secrets that await you in Alaska. The Denali State Park is one of the largest parks in the world, its organization makes it easier for visitors to admire without getting lost, the wide natural range offered to the public. In a simple walk you can observe wild animals of many species, from the American elk, squirrels, wolves, birds, to the friendly brown bears. We will end our trip admiring the Aurora Borealis, a true natural spectacle where the sky is dyed with colors and lights never before seen

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Kuala Lumpur, Melbrourne & California
programme.desc: We will begin our tour in the fascinating Asian continent, where we will have the opportunity to see the city of Kuala Lumpur from above. Kuala Lumpur is world famous for being the place where the Petronas towers are located, currently the tallest twin buildings in the world. We will enjoy its gastronomy that is composed mainly of Malaysian, Indian and Muslim flavors. And we will go for a walk to the Bukit Nanas Forest, one of the oldest virgin forests in the world in the interior of a city, which houses a great variety of flora and fauna of the native rainforest. And we will go through it in the most fun way, through the Canopy routes, with a series of hanging wooden bridges. Then, we will visit the Australian continent to discover all the adventures that the city of Melbourne hides, with all the ingredients to be one of the most attractive and interesting cities in the world: top quality restaurants, a very accessible public transport system and a calendar full of sporting, cultural events and artistic shows. And we will end our trip by taking excursions in California, United States in a walk through the Yosemite National Park, climbing the Tunnel View, one of the most famous sites of the park, which offers a perfect panorama of the Yosemite Valley and attracts more than 6,000 visitors a day during the summer.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Costa Rica, Iceland & Singapore
programme.desc: We begin our trip in Central America to immerse ourselves in the heat of Costa Rica through its volcanoes, its beaches and its people and we will make an extreme hiking tour that lasts approximately 10 hours, to reach the 7,000-year-old Arenal Volcano.Then, we move to northeastern Europe, to see contrasting places between impressive icebergs and beautiful black sand beaches that characterize Iceland. We will get in touch with the interior of Iceland traveling to Thingvellir, a national park located 45 kilometers northeast of the capital Reykjavik and will be the best time enjoying the typical Iceland cuisine. Finally, we go to the Asian continent where we have the opportunity to make a trip to the future in Singapore, one of the most modern cities in the world. We will go to one of the most visited attractions in the city, a walk suspended between the artificial "super trees" and then visit the Singapore Botanical Garden, with more than 150 years of history.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Chamonix Mont Blanc (France), Vienna (Austria) & Azores Island (Portugal)
programme.desc: We will start our tour visiting Chamonix, a French commune where we can slide in the snow in the many ski areas facing the valley. It is the closest city to the famous Mont Blanc, the highest mountain in Western Europe. We will finish our tour with an excursion in the Parc de Loisirs de Chamonix. Then we will travel to Vienna to immerse ourselves in its green waters and know part of its history. We will visit the famous St. Stephens Cathedral, the tallest building in the city. We will discover the curiosities of Vienna while we have a coffee in the traditional Cafe Central. We will finish our way through Vienna in the city of The Green Lake, or Gruner See, a well-known lake in Austria, located at the foot of the Hochschwab mountains. Finally, we will know the Azores Islands flying in paragliding. So spectacular are the places that the Azores offer for the paragliding flight that the site of "Sete Cidades", on the island of San Miguel, was considered, by a European jury, one of the 60 most beautiful places in Europe for free flight.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Pacific Coast, Santiago & Kerala (India)
programme.desc: We will begin our tour discovering the charms that it has to show the Pacific Coast of the United States with its beaches, which are ideal for surfing and also for the diversity of national parks that are there. An unimaginable world of adventures in which you can also taste a gastronomy characteristic of this area of the country. Then we go to Santiago de Chile, we will visit the Cerro San Cristobal or Metropolitan Park of Santiago, being this the largest urban park in the city and one of the most emblematic places of Santiago. We will taste the Curanto, a typical dish that in its preparation of traditional form consists of cooking food in the earth with the use of hot stones, a peculiar technique that turns it into a teamwork and makes it a special dish for the different celebrations, or if you prefer we will eat the delicious Chilean empanadas. And we will finish our trip in Kerala the epicenter of the largest tea-growing area of South India and we will enjoy the traditional Kathakali dances a dance style similar to the Japanese Kabuki dance that includes very eye-catching make-up and costumes and is a very important of Indian dance.

programme.title: The World Is Yours
programme.sub-title: The World Is Yours - Angkor, Hamburgo & Curacao
programme.desc: We started our expedition in Angkor, Cambodia, in one of the most spiritual ruins in the world, where once there was a city of great religious significance, Angkor Vat. This incredible temple is the largest religious monument in the world. From this thousand-year-old site we will fly to Hamburg, Germany, to get to a modern metropolis. And the largest department store district in the world in which buildings are built in the 19th and early 20th centuries on wooden foundations. And before we say goodbye to Hamburg, well go to the biggest amusement park and tourist center in northern Germany, with the longest mountain of all. Before we finish, we will fly to the island of Curacao, in the Antilles to immerse ourselves in the crystalline blue of the Caribbean Sea, and we will go to the Blue Rim, a very popular attraction for divers of all kinds.

programme.title: It’s How You Get There
programme.desc: Sam, Julian, and Jenn experience a variety of exciting modes of transportation as they journey across the country. They use things such as trucks, cars and motorcycles, and they also experiment with ATVs, boats, jet skis, and air travel. Each episode features their competition with each other, including wagers, witty banter and adrenaline to keep the viewers entertained. They are continuously learning as they try out these new modes to see which one they consider the best. This is "It's How You Get There".

programme.title: American Travelers
programme.desc: Dave & Kari visit Old Town Sacramento, located near their home town of Auburn.
